newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-MIZE TAKES LEAD IN COLORADO IN RAIN-INTERRUPTED FIRST ROUND.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-MIZE TAKES LEAD IN COLORADO IN RAIN-INTERRUPTED FIRST ROUND.

text.p: Larry Mize used a new putter and a new attitude to take the lead after his first round at the $1.7 million Sprint International on Thursday.
Mize compiled eight birdies and one bogey for a seven-under- par 65 in ideal morning conditions at Castle Pines near Denver.

"I putted with a new putter today and I had a good attitude with it," said Mize, who received 15 points in the modified stableford format which awards points for birdies and better and subtracts points for bogey and worse.
Mize led by one point from fellow-American Phil Mickelson, while Dave Stockton junior was three points behind.
Afternoon thunderstorms prevented half the field of 72 players from completing the round, which was scheduled to resume early Friday.
Best of those unable to complete the round was Jay Haas, on 10 points after five birdies in just eight holes.
Mize, 93rd on this year's PGA Tour money list, is regarded as one of the best putters in the game, but he hasn't been at his best lately.
Four birdies in the first seven holes, however, did wonders for his confidence, and he followed up with four more birdies on the back nine, before bogeying the last.
"I hit a lot of good mid-iron shots and gave myself a lot of putts for birdie," said the 1987 Masters champion. "Conditions were ideal with hardly a breath of wind."
Mickelson, meanwhile, did his Ryder Cup chances no harm with a strong round that included one eagle, five birdies and one bogey.
He has slipped to ninth spot on the U.S. Ryder Cup rankings and, with just three events left before the team to take on Europe is finalised, is far from assured of a berth.

The top 10 players after the PGA Championship will receive automatic selection, while captain Tom Kite will pick two others to complete the American team to take on Cup holder Europe at Valderrama (September 26-28).
"I honestly believed after winning Bay Hill (in March) that I had secured a spot on the Ryder Cup team," said Mickelson, who has not picked up any points in the past three months.

"I've played well, but I have not scored well. I just haven't had enough top 10 finishes. A good finish here could secure a spot and that's what I'm hoping for. With only three more events, it's definitely something I'm thinking about."
